div1.p: Hench requests copies of the material from Peabody's research on the yellow fever commission.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to the Librarian, Johns Hopkins University Welch Medical Library, September 18, 1940
div1.opener:
September 18, 1940
Librarian
The William H. Welch Medical Library
Johns Hopkins University
Baltimore, Maryland
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
I have been asked to give an address on the conquest of yellow fever
and the work of Reed and Lazear, at the dedication of the Lazear Memorial Building,
Washington and Jefferson College, Washington, Pennsylvania, October 26.

I have spent some time collecting data and have some interesting new
data which I shall be glad eventually to make available, either in the original or
in photostatic form, for your library. I understand from Dr. Peabody that he sub-
mitted some material for your Reed-Lazear collection. The Library of the University
of Virginia also gave me this information. I shall appreciate it greatly if you
will tell me what material you have and if I could get some of it in photostatic
form, as I intend, not only to write a short article on it, but to re-write the
entire story in long form. Incidentally, I have got both Kissinger and Moran to
write their stories for me, which I have had to check and edit and which is
soon ready for submitting for publication.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
